etymologies: late Middle English: from Old French monacorde, via late Latin from Greek monokhordon, neuter (used as a noun) of monokhordos ‘having a single string’

definitions: an instrument for comparing musical pitches mathematically, using a taut wire whose vibrating length can be adjusted with a movable bridge.
shortDefinitions: instrument for comparing musical pitches, using taut wire whose vibrating length can be adjusted with movable bridge
